item.title: Kick Off!
item.description: On the Xth of February 2021, the kick-off meeting of the NAUTILUS project took place at the premises of the Fundació Joan Costa Roma in Consorci Sanitari de Terrassa. Researchers from the different consortium members and supporting clinical centers met to kick off the project and discuss the study to be performed and agree on the different protocols and tasks. This meeting will guide the research actions in the coming months and support selecting participants in the study tests1.

item.title: Consortium
item.description: The main objective of NAUTILUS is to examine the impact of COVID-19 on neurobehavior and its relationship with illness severity. Besides, we aim to study structural and functional brain connectivity in a subsample of middle-aged post-COVID-19 individuals. Finally, we aim to develop predictive models of neurobehavioural evolution in post-COVID-19 based on multimodal data. The NAUTILUS project requires synergies between groups working from different fields and areas of expertise for addressing these challenging goals.

item.title: Contact
item.description: We are here to help you Are you curious about something? Are you interested in our project? Would you like to collaborate? Please feel free to contact us and we will reach you as soon as possible.

item.title: PROJECT INFORMATION
item.description: NAUTILUS is a project funded by Fundació La Marató de TV3 with the aim to understand pathophysiology of COVID-19 infection, including understanding mild disease and the role of co-infections / infection, transmissibility and viral shedding. Since its notification in December 2019, eighty-eight million cases of COVID-19 have been reported worldwide. Although most of these sufferers survive the infection, many people who have suffered from COVID-19 have long-term sequelae or persistent symptoms.
